oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Roll of the Reserve Military Corps of Tennessee for the 13th district of Shelby County
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Registers, lists, etc.; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Armed Forces -- Reserves; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Harris, Isham G. (Isham Green), 1818-1897
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Roster of the men who have served, are currently serving, and those who have not reported for duty in the Confederate Reserve Military Corps of Tennessee for the 13th district of Shelby County. Includes thirty-one men between the ages of eighteen and fourty-five and two between fourty-five and fifty-five who have served, and fourty-one between eighteen and fourty-five and six between fourty-five and fifty-five who have not, for a total of eighty men on the roll. Signed by F. C. Stephenson, Enrolling Officer.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee -- Adjutant-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Much of Shelby County fell under Federal control following the Federal naval attack on Memphis June 6, 1862. General Order No. 5 issued by Governor/Commander-in-Chief Isham G. Harris and Adjutant General W. C. Whitthorne on March 24, 1862, organized the state's Reserve Military Corps as required by an act of the General Assembly, passed March 18, 1862. This general order was issued from the Executive Headquarters at Memphis. Thus, it is assumed this reserve roll was recorded prior to the occupation of Memphis and subjugation of much of Shelby County.
